Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  Bishop Mitchell G. Taylor, Head Pastor, Center of Hope International Church, Long Island City, New York

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Gioia.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Bishop Mitchell G. Taylor, Head Pastor, Center of Hope International Church, Long Island City, New York.


Council Member Gioia moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title:
Introduction & Reading of Bills
See Attached
Discussion of Resolutions
Resolutons
General Discussion
Extension of Remarks
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
Resolution calling upon the New York City Water Board to provide homeowners aged sixty-two years and older a ten percent discount on water and sewer charges.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: NYC Water Board to provide homeowners aged sixty-two years and older a ten percent discount on water and sewer charges.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to eliminating the prearrangement and passenger manifest requirements for commuter vans.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Eliminating the prearrangement and passenger manifest requirements for commuter vans.

Items.Title: Resolution commemorating the life and mourning the death of baseball legend John Jordan “Buck” O’Neil.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Commemorating the life and mourning the death of baseball legend John Jordan “Buck” O’Neil.

Items.Title: Resolution honoring the life and achievements of award winning journalist Ed Bradley.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Honoring the life and achievements of award winning journalist Ed Bradley.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to radio communication between the New York City Police Department and the Emergency Medical Service and those that provide emergency medical service under the Fire Department’s 911 dispatch system.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Radio communication between the NYPD and EMS and those that provide emergency medical service under the Fire Department’s 911 dispatch system.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to pass “The 9/11 Comprehensive Health Benefits Act” (H.R. 6046), which would extend health care benefits to all affected individuals on the 9/11 disaster in an effective, easy-to-access manner.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Congress to pass “The 9/11 Comprehensive Health Benefits Act” (H.R. 6046).

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring notices relating to the rights of mobile phone consumers.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Requiring notices relating to the rights of mobile phone consumers.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to require that the practice of bottle service be limited to circumstances where it is performed and monitored by a waiter or waitress and calling upon the New York State Liquor Authority (SLA) to establish such monitored service as part of licensed alcohol-serving establishments’ “best practices.”
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Require that the practice of bottle service be limited to circumstances where it is performed and monitored by a waiter or waitress.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the United States Congress to pass House Bill 3760 and Senate Bill 1756 (H.R. 3760/S. 1756), the “Department of Peace and Nonviolence Act,” which would create a cabinet-level department headed by a Secretary of Peace who would advise the President on both domestic and international peace issues including non-military conflict resolution and human rights.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Congress to pass House Bill 3760 and Senate Bill 1756, the “Department of Peace and Nonviolence Act”.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to expanding the nuisance abatement law to include certain violations related to the creation, production, storage and sale of false identification documents, forged instruments and forgery devices.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Expanding the nuisance abatement law to include certain violations related to the production and sale of false identification.

Items.Title: Resolution amending and restating the resolution computing and certifying base percentage, current percentage and current base proportion of each class of real property for Fiscal 2007 to the state board of real property services pursuant to Section 1803-a, Real Property Tax Law.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Amending and Restating the Resolution Computing and Certifying Base Percentage, Current Percentage and Current Base Proportion of Each Class of Real Property for FY'07.

Items.Title: Resolution amending and restating the resolution computing and certifying adjusted base proportion of each class of real property for Fiscal 2007 to the State Board of Real Property Services pursuant to Section 1803-a, Real Property Tax Law.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Amending and Restating the Resolution Computing and Certifying Adjusted Base Proportion of Each Class of Real Property for FY'07.

Items.Title: Resolution amending and Restating the Resolution to Provide the Amounts Necessary for the Support of the Government of the City of New York and the Counties Therein and for the Payment of Indebtedness Thereof, for the Fiscal Year Beginning on July 1, 2006 and Ending on June 30, 2007, by the Levy of Taxes on the Real Property in the City of New York, in Accordance with the Provisions of the Constitution of the State of New York, the Real Property Tax Law and the Charter of the City of New York.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Amending and Restating the Resolution to Provide the Amounts Necessary for the Support of the Government of NY and the Counties Therein and for the Payment of Indebtedness Thereof, for the Fiscal Year Beginning on July 1, 2006 and Ending on June 30, 2007.
